title: Prisma setup error
body:
when i run npx prisma generate and db push it showes this Error: Prisma schema validation - (get-dmmf wasm)
Error code: P1012
error: Type "Questions" is neither a built-in type, nor refers to another model, composite type, or enum.
  -->  schema.prisma:28
   |
27 |   questionUid String
28 |   question    Questions @relation(fields: [questionUid], references: [uid], onDelete: Cascade, onUpdate: Cascade)
   |

Validation Error Count: 1
[Context: getDmmf]

Prisma CLI Version : 6.1.0   so how do i do it
author: janareddyc7

comments.body: hm okay strange - did you run `npx prisma init` first?

ERROR  File schema.prisma already exists in your project.
        Please try again in a project that is not yet using Prisma.

title: Suggest for questions
body: could there be a next button that take you to the next question instead of opening it again from the page
author: janareddyc7

comments.body: hey @janareddyc7 , great idea. is this once you've finished a question?
@janareddyc7 okay nice, currently it will display questions related to the one you have just answered - what would you like this one to do instead? ðŸ˜„
like add a next button for a next question to be displayed instead of relating questions

ah I see what you mean - currently there is not concept of a next question, as they are all there own questions with no links to one another. this is something I am looking at adding in the future - however I think for now related questions is the best I think we can do

title: env variable missing
body: when  try to run it there is like a variable missing for Claude i guess can you try to update the env variables
author: janareddyc7

comments.body: hey @janareddyc7 ! Look like I forgot to add the claude key to `.env.example` . I have since updated so could you pull down the latest changes and it should be there.

title: Question
body: Are the questions in a json file with the answere or are you fetching it from a website
author: janareddyc7

comments.body:
hey @janareddyc7 !ðŸ‘‹ 

Currently, the questions are stored in a db, but we are looking into creating a `seed.sql` file so you can populate the database with all the data that you will need via a single command. ðŸ˜Š

title: Contribution
body: Hey i wanted to contribute to this project but i found a issue on the env files is there any env variables to setup
author: janareddyc7

comments.body: hey @janareddyc7 ! It appears I forgot to add a `.env.example`. I will add one and get back to you once ready :)
hey @janareddyc7 ! I have just added the `.env.example` file. If you need anymore help setting up, please don't hesitate to reach out!
